snippet.title: In Disney's shadow, homeless families struggle
snippet.description: When they moved from Georgia to the theme park playground of central Florida four years ago, Anthony and Candice Johnson found work at a barbecue restaurant and a 7-Eleven. Their combined salaries nevertheless fell short of what they needed to rent an apartment, so the couple and their two children have instead been hopping among cheap motel rooms along U.S. 192.

snippet.title: Arlington National Cemetery, and the fight over Robert E. Lee's home
snippet.description: Incensed by Gen. Lee's defection, Union Gen. Meigs ordered the conversion of Lee's estate.

snippet.title: Stowaway on jet said to be homesick for Africa
snippet.description: A security video shows the California boy who survived stowing away on a jetliner dangling his feet from the aircraft's wheel well after arriving in Hawaii, before jumping 8 to 10 feet to the ground and collapsing, an airport official says.

snippet.title: Airport official: Teen had no clue he was in Maui
snippet.description: Long flights can leave anyone a little unsteady, but a teenager who defied the odds, surviving a flight from California to Hawaii tucked in a jetliner's wheel well, was disoriented, thirsty and could barely walk after the freezing, low-pressure ordeal, airport officials who reviewed video of his arrival said Wednesday.

snippet.title: Airport security vulnerabilities not uncommon
snippet.description: For all the tens of billions of dollars the nation has spent on screening passengers and their bags, few airports made a comparable investment to secure the airplanes.

snippet.title: Loudoun County volunteer opportunities
snippet.description: Nonprofit groups, town cleanup projects, agencies that aid seniors and pet rescue groups seek help.

snippet.title: Gray says he'll push forward on firefighter shift changes
snippet.description: D.C. mayor brushes off lame-duck concerns, says he'll implement controversial deployment proposal.

snippet.title: France unveils plan to stop youths joining jihad
snippet.description: France wants to deter youths from joining the ranks of Islamist militants in Syria's civil war, and is planning a series of tough-love measures that answer the pleas of parents and seek to protect the nation from battle-hardened returnees.

snippet.title: Wellness programs grow more popular with employers
snippet.description: That little voice nagging you to put down the cake and lace up the running shoes is increasingly coming from your employer and is likely to grow louder with a looming change under the federal health care overhaul.

snippet.title: Gay business owners still face challenges
snippet.description: It happens a few times a year: A customer refuses to work with Dave Greenbaum because he's gay.
